I've become totally obsessed with watching Hellsing on Web TV. It's an anime series set in Britain about a vampire called Alucard (or Arucard, depending on whether it's the show...or the credits.), who works for the Hellsing organization for unknown reasons. The Hellsing organization is a black ops force of 'Religious Knights', trained to killed vampires. It is led by Sir Integra(l) Wingates Hellsing, daughter of the founder, I believe. In the first episode, a vampire masquerades as a preist and kills a police unit and almost decimates a D-11 force, one of the members of which is Seras Victoria, or "Police Girl". She is captured by the vampire, and Alucard has to shoot through her to hit the vampire in the heart with his holy high caliber pistol. So, he drinks Seras' blood, making her his servant, but saving her life...in a way. She is now a vampire, and works for the Hellsing organization as Alucard's servant, and of course, using her Mad Vampire strength and skill to put the human members of Hellsing to shame...and so, they battle the forces of evil every episode, and I enjoy it immensely. I know, I'm a nerd, but I looooooooove Hellsing. That's my little spiel, because I love anime. I apologize to everyone who might think I'm wasting my time watching animes about vampires in Britain, where everyone coincidentally speaks Japanese. It's just so awesome. Alucard has the ability to become some kind of Hellhound to defeat the more powerful of his enemies, and wields large dual handguns, loaded with bullets made from melted crosses, which somehow kills vampires. Maybe they were silver crosses. Silver kills vamps, right? I know this is all very pointless, but I feel the need to rant about awesome things I come across. Also, Walter, the butler, is also known as the 'Angel of Death', and has the ability to spin threads from his fingers which can cut right through flesh and bone! Isn't that the coolest thing ever? Not to mention the gigantic gun that Seras recieves, which uses some kind of artillery shell, not kidding. And of course, she can wield it, even though it must weigh 50 kgs, not including the shell, because of her ultra vampire strength. So cool. I've probably bored you all enough. I'll slink into the shadows and watch my vampire anime. Peace out, this is the Dark Horse, signing off.

A road stretches off into the distance. It is long and winding, and in place of the yellow stripes we are all familiar with, dotting the middle of the road are golden bars. The mark of an Officer in the US military. The caption beside the closest bar reads: 'This is the bar of a Second Lieutenant. You earn it by taking ROTC in college. It means Officer, a leader of the United States Army. If you can acheive it, people will follow you.' The yellow bar underlines the picture, reading 'AN ARMY OF ONE' I found this ad in a magazine. You could squeeze the page and it would ooze red, white and blue. Really, how many American boys are pulled in by this? We've gone back to 1914. 'The Grand Adventure, War.' The boys, hardly out of school, go off to fight in the great war for freedom and heroism. They don't think that, in a few day's time, they could be lying in a ditch, cold, dirty, bloodied, begging for their mother as their bowels empty themselves through their ruptured gut. Or that they might come home short a limb or two, or not come home at all. It's the same today. Young men enter military service not realizing that they are giving their lives into the hands of an armed force, that is in conflict with another armed force, one that isn't clearly distinguished and easily fought. One that set explosives in cars, buildings, and just about anything they can get at. That includes the boys. In fact, their favorite target is a young American boy wearing those nice desert camos and wielding an M-16 and infidel ideologies. It all seems so far away when you hear it on the news, or read it in the paper. 'Four American GI's killed in Baghdad bombing'. We hear it almost every day. I ask you, how many people do you know who are in the military? Alleah has a brother in the Marine Corps. Will he be going to war? I don't know, actually. I'll have to ask her next time I see her. What's the point, people? To protect liberty and freedom? Please. Just think about how liberating and freeing you'd feel pointing a deadly weapon at people who didn't know you, didn't speak your language, or understand why you were shooting at them. So just think twice before you listen to that man with the shaved head and the army greens, my neighbor Americans. Think before you kill.

well, I promised a personal. Hey, why not, eh? Well, I've never written a personal, so obviously I haven't a clue where to begin. How about physical? I'm a WAS. White Anglo-Saxon. Not Protestant, however. Just under six foot, maybe 5'11". Medium build, not alot of fat, but not exactly skinny, either. Only very slightly muscular. Not quite shoulder length dark brown hair, blue/grey eyes, sporadic full beard/goatee when I decide to shave (which is not often). Usual dress includes jeans, occassionally shorts during the summer, sandals whenever possible, t-shirts, and corderuey jackets. Always cord. I don't wear any casual overcoat that isn't cord. Including my new cord trenchcoat. At the moment, I sometimes have a slight limp due to the three or four gashes in my left knee and shin. That's physically me. Now, how about personality? Well, I like to think I'm a nice guy, but sometimes I sure don't feel like it. That's why I'm writing this. Besides that whole fiasco, I'm generally a great guy. I'm about as thick as a rock, like most guys, I'm oblivious. But I'm sensitive and I actually listen when people talk to me. I'm passionate about what matters to me, and I'm very understanding about what matters to others. I'm not greedy or needy. I like having space sometimes, but others I just need to be with someone. I am constantly flirting, whether the person be female, or a theatre person. I'm not gay or bisexual, but I think gays and bis should have their rights, and I'm cheering for the other side, even though I don't play on it, haha! Anyway. I am a Buddhist, and I'm very into the philosophy of it. As such, I'd say I'm more tolerant than most people towards conflicting philosophies or religions. In a girl, there are a few things I am looking for. Basically, I'm looking for a soul I can bond with. I'm in it for a good, solid relationship, one that's comfortable, and casual. She has to be able to hold a conversation with me. Looks don't hurt, but it's the personality I'm looking for. In terms of looks, however, I'm not looking for someone who's anorexically skinny. I'm a sucker for a pretty face, especially nice eyes. Personality-wise, I'd like someone who shares some of my views. An activist, who knows something about the world and cares about it, and isn't afraid to be different. Someone like me, but not exactly. I'm definitely not looking for high-maintenance or materialistic. Someone spiritual and reflective that I can relate to and talk with. Obviously, I like to have fun. I like to go for walks in the Linley Valley, particularly Arbutus Bluff, where one can look down on Departure Bay and the surrounding area for kilometers. I also like to just hang out with friends, you know, usual teenager stuff. When I'm bored and alone, however, I like to head down and play some video games, preferably with someone else. Yeah, I'm a gamer, and something of a consumer whore for it and I'm sorry. I just like video games, what can I say? Other than that, I listen to alot of music, and talk to friends. I'm looking for a job, and I'm learning to drive, should have my N by the end of August, hopefully. So, that's my personal. If you fit me, and I fit you, and live in the area of Nanaimo BC, why don't you drop me a comment? I'm not being desperate, I simply psychicly knew this was what you wanted. Ahem...I guess this is just my way of giving you all a glimpse of me, I'm not really expecting anything out of it, but hey, you never know. This is the Single Dark Horse, signing off.
